name: Lost for Words! 14 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"What's it all about, ______? 
Is it just for the moment we live? 
What's it all about when you sort it out, ______?
Are we meant to take more than we give."
Which boy's name has gone amiss in this lyric?
questions.explanation:
Alfie.

	"Alfie" was a US hit for Dionne Warwick in 1966.  Another version of the same song was a UK hit for Cilla Black in the same year.  Cilla's version, which featured on the soundtrack of the 1966 film "Alfie", peaked at #9 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Groovin' on a ______ afternoon 
Really couldn't get away too soon." 
On which day of the week were the Young Rascals doing their groovin'?
questions.explanation:
Sunday.

	The Young Rascals had a hit with these lyrics from the song "Groovin'" in 1967.  The single was a US #1, peaking at #8 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Now that you're gone 
All that's left is a band of ______
All that's left of the dream I hold 
Is a band of ______ 
And the memories of what love could be 
If you are still here with me."
So what kind of band was it?
questions.explanation:
gold.

	"Band Of Gold" hit the charts for Freda Payne in 1970.  The single written by Dunbar and Wayne was a UK chart topper.

questions.text:
"Through the ______ of my mind 
Time after time 
I see reflections of you and me." 
Which word completes this Supremes song lyric?
questions.explanation:
mirror.

	These lyrics come from the Supremes 1967 song "Reflections".  This Motown hit, which peaked at #5 in the UK, was written by Brian Holland, Lamont Dozier and Edward Holland Jnr.

questions.text:
"I see a red door and I want it painted ______
No colours anymore, I want them to turn ______ 
I see the girls walk by dressed in their summer clothes 
I have to turn my head until my darkness goes." 
What colour did Mick Jagger want the door painted?
questions.explanation:
black.

	This classic Rolling Stones track topped the charts on both sides of the Atlantic.   "Paint It Black" was a hit in 1966.  As of 2004 the Rolling Stones have amassed thirty US Platinum Albums and nine Gold Albums.

questions.text:
"I'm starting with the man in the ______, oh!
I'm asking him to change his ways."
Where was the man in this Michael Jackson  song lyric?
questions.explanation:
mirror.

	"Man In The Mirror" was a hit for Michael Jackson in 1988.  Written by Siedah Garrett and Glen Ballard this US chart topper peaked at #21 in the UK.

questions.text:
"If you see a faded sign by the side of the road that says 
______ miles to the... Love Shack! Love Shack yeah."
Just how many miles was it to the Love Shack?
questions.explanation:
fifteen.

	These lyrics come from the  B-52's song  "Love Shack".  This US group hit the charts at #2 in the UK with this track in 1990.

questions.text:
"Cover me with kisses, baby 
Cover me with love 
Roll me in ______ sheets 
I'll never get enough."
What type of sheets did Blondie want to be rolled in?
questions.explanation:
designer.

	Blondie's "Call Me" was released in 1980.  The band, fronted by Deborah Harry, topped both the US and UK charts with this song.

questions.text:
"When I said I needed you, you said you would always stay 
It wasn't me who ______ but you, and now you've gone away 
Don't you see that now you've gone, and I'm left here on my own 
That I have to follow you and beg you to come home."
Which word is missing from this Dusty Springfield song?
questions.explanation:
changed.

	These lines come from the powerful ballad "You Don't Have To Say You Love Me"  by Dusty Springfield.  This song was a 1966 UK chart topper for Dusty, real name Mary O'Brien.  Dusty died in 1999.

questions.text:
"You're so ______, you probably think this song is about you 
You're so ______, I'll bet you think this song is about you 
Don't you? Don't You?"
And finally he's so what?
questions.explanation:
vain.

	"You're So Vain" was written and sung by Carly Simon.  This 1972 song was a US #1, peaking at #3 in the UK.
